basic_info.description_header: a Developer, a Researcher, Quant and a Crypto Lover
basic_info.description: Jeffrey works as Algo Engineer at BlackRock where he develops advanced algorithms and optimization methods to create next-generation portfolio trading engine. He also has a strong research background in machine learning and large-scale/unstructured data analysis (former Analytical Chemistry Lab Researcher)
basic_info.passions: Through various trading competitions and rigorous MFE coursework, Jeffrey possesses hands-on experience in alpha generation, statistical arbitrage, and asset allocation models. He is also passionate about crypto and Defi applications, including a passive income stacking strategy registers 80% APY from yield farm

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!

experience.title: Algo Engineer Associate, ETF & Index Investing
technologies: • Architect wholistic framework to automate portfolio management through meta-algo to build next-generation efficient trading engine library for BlackRock. Current team AUM 50B+
• Built efficient algorithms for data pipeline and hyper api to enhance dataflow performance between data storage and portfolio interface, presented 3x faster runtime in result
• Designed decision system to automate the ETF creation/redemption process that matches trading limitations and constraints for industry, sector, country etc

experience.title: UCLA Joint Researcher
technologies: • Perform a research on the optimization techniques for passive tracking portfolio, including indepth study on stratified sampling in 3-dimensional strata, mix-integer optimizer and asset allocation model
• Constructed a portfolio to passively tracks the Bloomberg Barclay US aggregate fixed income index using stratified sampling in 3-dimensional strata with different characteristics
• Build a convex optimizer (mixed-integer) to create two-layer portfolio optimized weights that match the duration, convexity, and DTS of the benchmark
• Developed asset sector allocation model from optimized portfolio to maximize the yield with constraint tracking errors

experience.title: Derivative Strats Intern
technologies: • Using machine learning models tools to analyze VIX future trading strategies pattern and building quantitative models to support new index development and derivative in-house pricing librabry
• Utilized machine learning tools (Kmeans and DTW) to build time-seires classification model to identify VIX futures trading strategies
• Collaborated with Northwestern University Professors to implement a new left-tail index that introduces robust measure of volatility jump risk

experience.title: Quantitative Analyst Intern
technologies: • Work with Seasoned Quant Reseacher and Machine Learning Engineer do develop comprehensive and robust deep learning model for alpha generation
• Engineered data pipeline for Big-Data (over 20 GB and +200M datapoint of index returns) to proxy market dynamics
• Analyzed the impact of the VIX regimes switching on the portfolio's performance and provided stepwise improvements
• Built back-testing tools for drawdown and alpha calculation and performed code optimization

education.coursework: Coursework (GPA: 3.6/4.0): Statistical Arbitrage, Credit Markets, Machine Learning & Data Analytics, Quantitative Asset Management, Computational Finance, Stochastic Calculus, Fixed Income, Derivatives Markets, Empirical Methods in Finance, Econometrics, Investments, Risk Measurement and Management, Financial Decision Making

Relevant Coursework (GPA: 3.5/4.3): Advanced Statistics, Calculus I&II, Data mining, Computer Programming, Using R for Data Analysis, Advanced Software Development, Laboratory Research and Training I&II (Identification of bacterial pathogens using mass spectrometry with unsupervised learning, Paper featured at 7th World Chinese Mass Spectrometry Conference)

education.degree: Exchange Student with focus on Movie Study
